intro: Megalastrum inaequalifolium, commonly known as the unequal-leaved megalastrum, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, and has palmate leaves with three to five lobes. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
